names.name: George Liu
names.bio: My past initiatives include serving as CORE's treasurer, leading the How to Start a Startup discussion seminars, co-organizing the CORE Product Challenge, and running CORE 3D printing initiatives. I'm currently the executive director of Almaworks, Columbia University's fall startup accelerator for New York college entrepreneurs.

names.name: Jackie Luo
names.bio: I joined CORE at the start of college and served as vice president my sophomore year. I've led initiatives like #StartupColumbia and Ignite@CU, and I'm currently working on our technical infrastructure and the Silicon Valley tech trek. I interned this past summer at Percolate in New York.

names.name: James Xue
names.title: Editor-in-Chief of Impulse
names.bio: I've been with CORE Impulse since it was just "the blog" back in 2013, and I'm currently the editor-in-chief. We've grown a talented team, a large audience, and a site with some awesome content! I've worked at a tech startup in Hong Kong, a research lab in Tokyo, startups in NYC, and an IT consultancy in London. I also like Game of Thrones!

names.name: Jamie Song
names.title: Secretary
names.bio: Jamie has worked on CORE Impulse, social media, and Women@CORE. She’s worked at a startup accelerator in South Korea and went to Draper University in San Mateo. Always down for coffee so feel free to reach out!

names.name: Josh Zweig
names.bio: Josh has worked on the Global Tech Treks and the Startup Internship Program, and is currently planning Ignite@CU. Josh is excited to help design the Internet of Things world, and in his spare time enjoys hard problems, adventure, and juggling.

names.name: Kat Moon
names.bio: I'm excited about the intersection of startups, media, and everything global—hence my involvement in leading CORE's inaugural London/Paris tech treks and hosting Greek-American entrepreneur Arianna Huffington. When I'm not leading outreach initiatives for InterVarsity Christian Fellowship, I'm crafting content for The Muse where my work has been published on platforms like TIME, Forbes, and Mashable.

names.name: Kimberly Hou
names.title: Vice President
names.bio: A pianist in the Columbia-Juilliard Exchange, I wanted to share one of my earliest passions by founding Columbia Pops, Columbia’s first pops orchestra. I'm majoring in neuroscience and hope to work in product management. As part of CORE, I've led the VC Analyst Internship Program, two bio-health panels, and marketing/logistics for bringing Peter Thiel to speak at Columbia.

names.name: Miranda Li
names.bio: I work with employers at CORE and leads the Startup Internship Program. I like spending time walking around New York aimlessly (and in the summers, San Francisco), introducing people to others, thinking, talking about philosophy, and attempting to sing. I'm studying abroad at Oxford next year but will strive to embody the CORE evangelist inside me while I'm there!

names.name: Sara Sakowitz
names.bio: In the past, I've worked on #StartupColumbia and the Columbia Venture Competition, as well as some of our larger (and smaller!) speaker events. I'm also working on Ignite@CU this year. When I'm not working on CORE, I'm leading my own startup, Blue Moon Box. I'm also involved in cancer research and plan to pursue an MD/PhD after college.

names.name: Simon Schwartz
names.title: President
names.bio: I grew up on a farm in Virginia, which, as I tell anyone who listens, has prepared me uniquely for life as an entrepreneur. I joined CORE as a freshman and knew instantly that it was the most useful thing I'd do at CU. I've spent time in VC, as well as hardware and finance startups, and spend my free time thinking how entrepreneurship can help rural communities.

names.name: Anshul Gupta
names.bio: I've been in CORE since fall of my freshman year and have seen the organization grow vigorously from just a handful of overenthusiastic folks to a group of nearly seventy overenthusiastic folks. This past summer, I interned as a software developer intern at Bloomberg. I work on CORE's technical infrastructure, #StartupColumbia, and the Columbia Venture Competition.

names.name: Connie Long
names.bio: I joined CORE as one of the early members of CORE Impulse. I've served as co-Editor-in-Chief and am continuing as Strategy and Operations Officer for the blog to further develop its internal teams. I love to travel (studying abroad in Buenos Aires, interning in London, etc.) and can't wait for the next CORE tech trek!

names.name: Christy Chung
names.bio: Since fall semester of 2014, I have been involved in social entrepreneuship and event coordination in CORE. I am also interested in the intersection between education and social entrepreneurship! I was a summer intern at CLSA (Credit Lyonnais Securities Asia) and Hong Kong Refugee Advice Center. I also love reading and traveling!

names.name: Kristina Wald
names.bio: I joined CORE at the beginning of my sophomore year and have been involved with initiatives like organizing dinners with entrepreneurs and building community within CORE. I fell in love with startups after interning at a wedding startup in Chicago. Hobbies include sleeping, taking walks, playing piano, reading, and memorizing poetry.

names.name: Sahir Jaggi
names.bio: I'm a founding member of the Columbia Makerspace and currently working on CORE's entrepreneurship orientation program, which introduces first-year students to the startup world.

names.name: Victoria Lee
names.bio: I'm a CORE-fanatic and have been involved with the Women@CORE mentorship, Columbia's undergraduate venture competition, and CORE's first-ever food innovation event. I interned this past spring at a startup called Fundera. In my spare time, I can be found Yelping best places to eat in Manhattan.

names.name: Zach Gleicher
names.bio: The past three summers, I've interned at Qualcomm and Google. Currently, I'm working on Almaworks, CORE's student-run accelerator. Long-term, I hope to get involved in an early-stage technology startup or launch my own venture.

names.name: Abigail Kim
names.bio: In fall 2014, I planned and moderated a panel on entrepreneurship in the fashion industry, featuring top-of-the-line fashion editors, bloggers, and designers. My focus in CORE has been on expanding our definition of entrepreneurship outside of tech to include innovators who push boundaries in creative fields. This year, I will be abroad, studying in Berlin, Germany.
